body_html:
nit: Do we want to add a flag to enable/disable NNPack at runtime, like we do for cudnn?
According to @alykhantejani experience using NNPack in Caffe2, for some configurations (apparently when the dimensions are not a power of two), NNPack can be significantly slower than the baseline convolution from Caffe2 with MKL.
body_text:
nit: Do we want to add a flag to enable/disable NNPack at runtime, like we do for cudnn?
According to @alykhantejani experience using NNPack in Caffe2, for some configurations (apparently when the dimensions are not a power of two), NNPack can be significantly slower than the baseline convolution from Caffe2 with MKL.
body:
nit: Do we want to add a flag to enable/disable NNPack at runtime, like we do for cudnn?
According to @alykhantejani experience using NNPack in Caffe2, for some configurations (apparently when the dimensions are not a power of two), NNPack can be significantly slower than the baseline convolution from Caffe2 with MKL.
